info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:02AM MST until December 28 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, locally higher benches. * WHERE...Utah Valley, Northern Wasatch Front and Salt Lake Valley. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 4 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on winter driving conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will cross the area between 4-7 PM. Moderate to heavy snow is expected with this front which may quickly impact the Monday evening commute. There is some potential for additional lake and terrain enhanced snow Monday night into early Tuesday morning, that could result in locally higher totals, especially on the benches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
